result.execSummary:
The defendant Alex J. J. Kobza was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g) [Modifiers: Conspiracy to Commit], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.
  • Purchase Pseudoephedrine for Another with Intent/Facilitate Another Person's Manufacture of Meth, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.453(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The costs are to be paid at the rate of $25.00 a month beginning April 24, 2015.

The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.  

Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall undergo an AODA and follow through with any recommendations.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.  Defendant shall have a mental health evaluation and comply with all treatment recommendations.  Probation is to note any counseling that he is already receiving.  Defendant shall have no contact with G.P., T.A., J.H. and R.H.  Defendant shall testify truthfully if subpoenaed in the cases against G.P., T.A., J.H. and R.H.  Defendant shall undergo counseling as deemed appropriate by probation.    Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.

timeConds.notes: The jail sentence may be served with huber and may be served in separate intervals at the discretion of probation so he does not lose his social security.  The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.  Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.

Defendant Alex J. J. Kobza in court with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement put into the record.  District attorney amends count 4 to Conspiracy to Manufacture Meth less than 2 grams 961.41(1)(e)1.   Defendant pleads guilty to Count 3, Count 4 and Count 7.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Court orders in Count 3 - straight sentence - court costs; DNA Surcharge and 14 days county jail with huber and good time -  14 days sentence credit.  Count 4 - withheld sentence, probation four years with conditions of 58 days county jail with huber may be served in separate intervals at discretion of probation officer so he does not lose his social security; may be served in any other county; court costs; DNA sample; AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations; mental health evaluation and comply with all treatment recommendations noting any counseling that he his already receiving.  ; no contact with G.P., T.A., J.H. and R. H. except for limited contact to get his belongings.; testify truthfully if subpoenaed in the cases against G.P., TA., J.H. and R.H. and counseling as deemed appropriate by probation.  Count 7 - withheld sentence, probation for 3 years with conditions of court costs; AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations; mental health evaluation and comply with all treatment recommendations; no contact with G.P., T.A., J.H. and R. H.; testify truthfully if subpoenaed in the cases against G.P., TA., J.H. and R.H. and counseling as deemed appropriate by probation.  Remaining counts are dismissed and read in. Count 3 defendant will pay $25.00 a month beginning April 24, 2015.  - rt

arrest

Attorney Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Alex J. Kobza appeared in person, in custody.  Court finds probable cause for arrest without warrant based on the arrest header.  Attorney Tlusty requested a $1,000.00 cash bond; booking; no contact with G.L.P. and T.J.A.; no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Court orders bond as requested by Attorney Tlusty.  Notice of right to an attorney given to defendant.   Next court date is scheduled for November 4, 2014 at 1:00 p.m.  - rt
